{
  "paper_metadata": {
    "title": "Optimizing rice yield, quality and nutrient use efficiency through combined application of nitrogen and potassium",
    "authors": [
      "Guangyi Chen",
      "Qiang Duan",
      "Chaoyue Wu",
      "Xingmei He",
      "Mingming Hu",
      "Congmei Li",
      "Yuyuan Ouyang",
      "Ligong Peng",
      "Hong Yang",
      "Qiuqiu Zhang",
      "Qinggui Jiang",
      "Yan Lan",
      "Tian Li"
    ],
    "journal": "Frontiers in Plant Science",
    "publication_year": 2024,
    "doi": "10.3389/fpls.2024.1335744",
    "study_region": "Wenjiang city, Sichuan Province, China",
    "primary_focus": "Optimizing rice yield, quality, and nutrient use efficiency through combined nitrogen and potassium application"
  },
  "research_methodology": {
    "study_type": "field_experiment",
    "experimental_design": "Two-factor factorial field trials with three levels of N and four levels of K, using a randomized complete block design with three replicates. Twelve treatments were established by the complete combination of N and K application rates.",
    "temporal_scope": {
      "study_duration_years": 2,
      "data_collection_frequency": "At full heading stage, maturity stage, and mid-filling stage (for RNA samples).",
      "seasonal_coverage": "Rice growing seasons (April/May to September) in 2019 and 2020.",
      "monitoring_timeline": [
        "Seeds sown: 12 April 2019, 14 April 2020",
        "Seedlings transplanted: 27 May 2019, 26 May 2020",
        "Full heading stage sampling: 9 Aug 2019, 13 Aug 2020",
        "Maturity stage sampling: 14 Sept 2019, 15 Sept 2020",
        "Rice harvested: 19 Sept 2019, 20 Sept 2020",
        "Mid-filling stage (RNA): 15 days after flowering"
      ]
    },
    "spatial_scope": {
      "number_of_sites": 1,
      "geographic_coverage": "Research farm of Sichuan Agricultural University, Wenjiang city, Sichuan Province, China",
      "site_characteristics": [
        "Clay soil",
        "Continuously flooded with river water"
      ],
      "coordinates": "30°70′ N, 103°83′ E",
      "regional_representativeness": "Southwest China, where the cultivar Yixiangyou 2115 is widely cultivated."
    },
    "sample_design": {
      "sample_sizes": {
        "dry_matter_hills": 10,
        "effective_tillers_plants_per_plot": 30,
        "yield_components_plants": 10,
        "rice_quality_plants": 10,
        "replicates_per_treatment": 3
      },
      "replication_levels": "Three replicates per treatment.",
      "randomization_approach": "Randomized complete block design.",
      "controls_and_treatments": [
        "Nitrogen (N) application rates: 135 kg ha⁻¹ (N1), 180 kg ha⁻¹ (N2), 225 kg ha⁻¹ (N3)",
        "Potassium (K) application rates: 0 kg ha⁻¹ (K0), 90 kg ha⁻¹ (K1), 135 kg ha⁻¹ (K2), 180 kg ha⁻¹ (K3)",
        "Zero-N plot (for N use efficiency calculation)",
        "Zero-K plot (for K use efficiency calculation)"
      ],
      "statistical_power": "Not explicitly stated, but p-values and significance levels are reported."
    },
    "analytical_methods": {
      "measurement_protocols": [
        "Dry matter determination: Oven-dried at 105°C for 30 min, then to constant weight at 80°C.",
        "N concentration: Digested with concentrated H₂SO₄ and H₂O₂, determined using a continuous flow analyzer.",
        "K concentration: Digested with concentrated H₂SO₄ and H₂O₂, determined using a flame photometer.",
        "RNA isolation: RNA Trizol reagent.",
        "Reverse transcription: Revertase Transcription kit.",
        "RT-qPCR: Real-time PCR detection system with SYBR Green Master Mix, using rice Actin gene as internal control.",
        "Grain yield: Adjusted to 13.5% moisture content.",
        "Milling quality: Processed with rice huller, polished with rice milling machine, head rice separated with broken rice separator.",
        "Appearance quality: Determined using a grain appearance analyzer.",
        "Pasting properties (RVA): Measured using an RVA device with distilled water.",
        "Sensory properties (eating quality): Measured using a rice sensory analyzer after cooking in a multifunctional, timed food steamer.",
        "Texture properties (eating quality): Measured using a rice texture analyzer."
      ],
      "instrumentation": [
        "Continuous flow analyzer (AA3, Seal Analytical Inc., Southampton, UK) for N.",
        "Flame photometer (M-410, Sherwood Scientific Ltd., Cambridge, UK) for K.",
        "RNA Trizol reagent (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA).",
        "Revertase Transcription kit (Nanjing Vazyme Medical Technology Co., Ltd., Nanjing, China).",
        "Real-time PCR detection system (SYBR Green Master Mix, Vazyme).",
        "Rice huller (JLG-2118, Taizhou Food Instrument Co., Ltd., Zhejiang, China).",
        "Rice milling machine (JNMJ-3, Taizhou Food Instrument Co., Ltd., Zhejiang, China).",
        "Broken rice separator (FQS-13X20, Taizhou Food Instrument Co., Ltd., Zhejiang, China).",
        "Grain appearance analyzer (JMWT12, Dongfu Jiuheng Instrument Technology Co., Ltd., Beijing, China).",
        "RVA device (3-D, Newport Scientific, Sydney, Australia).",
        "Rice sensory analyzer (STA 1B, Satake Asia Co., Ltd., Tokyo, Japan).",
        "Multifunctional, timed food steamer (GF-339, Goodway Electrical Enterprise Ltd., Hong Kong, China).",
        "Rice texture analyzer (RHS 1A, Satake Asia Co., Ltd., Tokyo, Japan)."
      ],
      "quality_control": [
        "Residuals tested for randomness, homogeneity, and normal distribution for ANOVA assumptions.",
        "Rice Actin gene used as internal control for RT-qPCR."
      ],
      "detection_limits": {},
      "analytical_precision": {
        "standard_deviation_reported": "Yes, for all quantitative data (mean ± standard deviation, n=3)."
      }
    },
    "statistical_approach": {
      "analysis_methods": [
        "Analysis of variance (ANOVA).",
        "Binary quadratic fitting equation for yield response to N and K application rates.",
        "Correlation analysis."
      ],
      "significance_testing": "Least significant difference (LSD) test at the 0.05 probability level (p < 0.05).",
      "uncertainty_quantification": "Mean ± standard deviation.",
      "model_validation": "Assumptions of variance analysis were tested (residuals random, homogenous, normal distribution). No external validation for the binary quadratic model was mentioned."
    }
  },
  "quantitative_findings": {
    "primary_measurements": [
      {

        "measurement_context": "Maximum increases obtained under N3K2 treatment."
      },

        "measurement_context": "Maximum increase under N3K2 in 2020."
      },
      {

        "values": [
          "176.30"
        ],

        "statistical_measures": {},
        "measurement_context": "Maximum increase under N3K2 in 2019."
      },
      {
        "parameter": "Increase in total K uptake at maturity stage (compared to other treatments)",
        "values": [
          "88.21"

        "units": "%",
        "statistical_measures": {},
        "measurement_context": "Maximum increase under N3K1 in 2020."
      },
      {

        "values": [
          "193.30-236.86"

      },

{

    ],
    "journal": "Scientific Reports",
    "publication_year": 2021,
    "doi": "10.1038/s41598-021-90297-1",
    "study_region": "Argentine Pampas, Southern Santa Fe region",
    "primary_focus": "Potassium (K) depletion in agricultural soils, particularly subsoil, due to continuous K removal without replenishment."
  },
  "research_methodology": {
    "study_type": "field_experiment",

    "temporal_scope": {
      "study_duration_years": 9,
      "data_collection_frequency": "Soil samples collected in 2000, 2004 (0-20 cm), and 2009 (0-100 cm). Annual K budgets estimated.",
      "seasonal_coverage": "Early spring for soil sampling.",
      "monitoring_timeline": [
        "2000 (study onset, initial soil sampling)",
        "2004 (mid-term soil sampling, 0-20 cm)",
        "2009 (end of study, comprehensive soil profile sampling 0-100 cm)"
      ]
    },
    "spatial_scope": {
      "number_of_sites": 4,
      "geographic_coverage": "Southern Santa Fe region, Central Pampas of Argentina.",
      "site_characteristics": [
        "Balducchi: Typic Hapludolls, +60 years cropping history",
        "San Alfredo: Typic Argiudolls, 8 years cropping history",
        "La Blanca: Typic Hapludolls, +6 years cropping history",
        "La Hansa: Aquic Argiudolls, +20 years cropping history"
      ],
      "coordinates": "Balducchi (34° 9′ 26.0″ S, 61° 36′ 33.8″ W), San Alfredo (33° 53′ 14.1″ S, 61° 27′ 30.5″ W), La Blanca (33° 29′ 57.2″ S, 62° 37′ 55.3″ W), La Hansa (32° 23′ 04.2″ S, 61° 11′ 58.8″ W)",
      "regional_representativeness": "Representative of Mollisols in the Argentine Pampas region."
    },
    "sample_design": {
      "sample_sizes": {
        "replicates_per_treatment": 3,
        "soil_subsamples_per_plot": 3,
        "soil_depths_sampled_2009": 5
      },
      "replication_levels": "Three replicates per treatment at each site.",
      "randomization_approach": "Randomized complete block design.",
      "controls_and_treatments": [
        "Control: No fertilizer applied.",
        "NPS: Nitrogen, Phosphorus, and Sulfur fertilizers applied.",
        "Pristine: Adjacent soils with no prior agricultural history."
      ],
      "statistical_power": "Not explicitly stated, but statistical significance (p < 0.05) and power analysis (e.g., sample size justification) are implied by the use of mixed effect models and Tukey's HSD."
    },
    "analytical_methods": {
      "measurement_protocols": [
        "Soil extractable-K: pH 7 buffered 1.0 M ammonium-acetate method (NH4-OAc-K) [56]",
        "Slowly-exchangeable K: Modified sodium tetraphenyl boron method (NaBPh4-K) [9]",
        "Soil organic carbon (SOC)",
        "Soil-test P [51]",
        "Soil pH (1:2.5 soil:water) [52]",
        "Bulk density [53]",
        "Secondary elements [54, 55]",
        "Soil texture: Measured at 0-20 cm at onset; 20-100 cm layers obtained from INTA Soil Survey Summary.",
        "Grain K concentrations: Assumed constant based on 2000-2002 average values (4.0 g K kg-1 for maize, 5.7 g K kg-1 for wheat, 19.0 g K kg-1 for soybean)."
      ],
      "instrumentation": [],
      "quality_control": [
        "Standardized methods cited for soil analysis.",
        "Assumptions of normality and homogeneity of variance formally evaluated (Shapiro-Wilks normality test)."
      ],
      "detection_limits": {},
      "analytical_precision": {}
    },
    "statistical_approach": {
      "analysis_methods": [
        "Mixed effect model with repeated measures over time (for K budget and topsoil NH4-OAc-K) using 'nlme' package [56].",
        "Mixed effect models with repeated measures over space (soil depth) for vertical distributions of K fractions.",
        "Analysis of variance (ANOVA) partitioned by location.",
        "Regression analyses (simple linear, partial linear, linear-plateau) for soil K depletion drivers.",
        "Stepwise selection using 'stepAIC' function from 'MASS' package [59]."
